TopicTitle: Check out our new IRC Channel

Articles.Content:
Hi,

Just wanted to let everyone know, we have a new official IRC channel up now, and we will be phasing out the old one soon.

Why the change? The old IRC channel was created unofficially, and we here had no control at all over it. This one has been set up so that we can have full control, and it\'s based on the very awesome EsperNet. It should be a better experience overall now.

You can check it out by connecting to esper.net with your IRC client, and joining the #kspofficial channel.

Just keep in mind, the same rules of conduct we enforce on the forum are also in effect there (and so are the moderators).

Cheers

Edited August 1, 2013 by Ted

For those which are having difficulty joining, enter this into your IRC program.

irc://irc.esper.net/kspofficial

Also who registered Nomad before me

For those which are having difficulty joining, enter this into your IRC program.

irc://irc.esper.net/kspofficial

Also who registered Nomad before me

thanks
Im probably gonna sound stupid, but whats IRC and where (if its a program) do i get it?

Im probably gonna sound stupid, but whats IRC and where (if its a program) do i get it?

Internet Relay Chat - the first IM system on the net essentially.

Google it up. There are many clients to choose from including browser based ones.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Looks like a great new IRC channel!

So all the forum mods are mods there?

So all the forum mods are mods there?

Yes, since the same rules apply there as well as the forums. Get Damion to set you up with ops.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Ok well - this is some Web irc client - it can be used like standart html link

http://cbe003.chat.mibbit.com/?channel=%23kspofficial&server=irc.esper.net&charset=windows-1251

or like this

JOIN TO KSP CHAT

Sorry for asking here but the topic about the new forum is closed for some reason.

I can't find the OpenID login on the new vBulletin forum. Can this new "more reliable and powerful tool" even handle it?
There is no openid support for vbulletin, that's why you don't see it. The people who make openid don't have a package for vbulletin. So it's their fault, not vbulletin's.

I'd like to point out that we are now hovering around the 100 members online mark in IRC. Stop in and have a chat with some of the well known modders and members of the community!

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
